title: Let’s talk about the OTT shows we’re watching…
summary: Starting a thread for OTT shows / recommendations etc.
full_review:
Starting a thread for OTT shows / recommendations etc.

What have you guys been watching? As for me…

While waiting for the new season ofYou, which I am watching now, I asked around for recommendations.The new season ofThe Last of Usis something I desperately want to watch, but I want the whole season to drop — and not watch it on a weekly basis. So… what now? I started watchingThe White Lotusa while ago, but gave up midway through SIE1. It wasn’t that Idislikedit, but I felt it was too lightweight for my then-mood, and wanted something heavier. But when my producer recommended it again, recently, I said “why not” – and this time, I really got into it. I think the biggest achievement of the show is in balancing a breezy tone (which I earlier dismissed as “lightweight”) with dark truths about people and relationships. It’s an “easy watch” — and yet, it’s more than an easy watch. Some portions made me pause and rewind and rewatch, and I seriously did not expect this much “truth” in a show like this. Note to self, if still needed:Always keep your mind open.

Reproducing (from IMDb) one particular stretch of dialogue that I kept rewatching, with my favourite parts in bold:

[Ethan has just told Daphne he thinks something happened between Cameron and Harper. After he tells her this, Daphne briefly mulls over the situation, her demeanor going into a troubled state at first, but ending in an air of unflappability]

Daphne : [to Ethan] I don’t think you have anything to worry about.

[Ethan gives a confused look]

Daphne: I mean, we never really know what goes on in people’s minds or what they do, right? You spend every second with somebody and there’s still this part that’s a mystery. You know?You don’t have to know everything to love someone. A little mystery? It’s kinda sexy.

[Ethan cracks a smile]

Daphne: I’m a mystery to myself. Honestly, I surprise myself all the time.I think you just… you just… do whatever you have to do not to feel like a victim of life.You know? Just use your imagination.

PS:Comedy-wise, laughed way too ‘hard’ at this:

Albie: No girl should have to be exposed to an old guy’s junk.

Albie’s grandfather: It’s not like it was ever so beautiful to look at anyway.I mean, it’s a penis. It’s not a sunset.

PPS: Next up,Secrets We Keep, a six-episode Danish crime-thriller that I heard is quite good.
